p: Fig 1B shows the estimated number of days needed for the national epidemic to reach its incidence peak in the select countries. In Italy, the peak was reached after 122 days (~4 months), whereas in Pakistan it was reached after 350 days (nearly a year). Meanwhile, since R 0<1, no epidemic would emerge in Niger. Of note that the number of days needed for the national epidemic to reach its incidence peak depends on the population size in addition to R 0â€”it takes more time for the epidemic to reach its peak in larger nations (S3-S8 Tables in S1 File).
